front.title: LSP Attributes Related Routing Backus-Naur Form

abstract.t: Multiprotocol Label Switching (MPLS) Label Switched Paths (LSPs) established using the Resource Reservation Protocol Traffic Engineering (RSVP-TE) extensions may be signaled with a set of LSP specific attributes. These attributes may be carried in both Path and Resv messages. This document specifies how LSP attribute are to be carried in RSVP Path and Resv messages using the Routing Backus-Naur Form, and clarifies related Resv message formats. This document updates RFC 4875 and RFC 5420.
